CAREER SUMMARY  
 
2010 to date Sipcam Oxon Spa  
Position: Supply Chain and Toll Manufacturing Manager  
Headquarter of Sipcam Oxon Group operating in research, development, production 
and marketing of agrochemicals.  Sipcam Oxon Group has 850 people worldwide, 7 
production plants in the world and the consolidated turnover is about 500 millions €  
 
Directly reporting to the Purchasing and Commercial Director the role is focused on:  
• providing all the technical active ingredients used in formulation plants  
• production planning coordination for both synthesis plants and formulation 
plants  
    
• supervision of the information flow from the purchasing department to the  
• customer service  
• Third Par ty contract management and drawing up  
• Stock managing and control  
 
2015 to 2017 Sipcam Inagra SA – Valencia (Spain)  
Position: APS and on line sales platform Project leader  
Sipcam  Oxon Group affiliate with formulation plant placed in Sueca (120 people / 
20.000 Mtons per year / 100.000  square meters) and offices placed in Valencia (30 
people)  
 
Directly reporting to Usa and Spain CEO the project consists in a change management 
of production planning and sales forecasting through the introduction of a new APS 
software connected to the existing MES (Captor) and connected also with the ERP 
(Oracle JDEdwards).The main aim is the efficiency increasing of the plant in order to 
control it b etter.  
 
This project also includes the on line sales platform integrated in the ERP system and 
supported by the feedback of the APS production planning (first step of the project). 
The main purpose of this second step is a clear customer comunication with a reliable 
and precise delivery for the product without stock.  
Project results: - 20% stock equal to – 4 million € considering both row material stock 
(Sipcam Inagra) and finished product stock (Sipcam Iberia) . 
 
2008 to 2010 Sipcam Spa – Salerano sul Lamb ro (LO)  
Position: Warehouse and Logistic Manager  
 
Formulation plant of the Sipcam Oxon Group Salerano plant area is 300.000 square 
meters and average production is 26000 MTons per year  
 
Directly reporting to the plant manager main activities were:  
• raw material and packaging office coordination  
• shipping office (domestic and international) coordination  
• production balance reporting for toll manufacturer customer (with particular 
attention on production scraps and row material specifications)  
• stock level ma nagement (the accordance between accounting stock of the ERP 
system and the real stock included)  
• waste disposal warehousing  
• hazardous goods warehousing  
• third party warehousing for customers  
• The team work coordinated was 16/18 people considering both perman ent 
plant employees and external workers (forklift operators)  
 
2006 to 2008 AMIK Spa  
Position: IT and Support Manager  
An international company based in Milan San Paolo and Shanghai operating in world 
wide trading of chemical products.  
Turnover: 50 mln Total employees: 40  
 
Directly reporting to the b oard main activities were:  
• Import Area: checking of goods shipping, prepar ation of all documents 
concerning banks and suppliers, administration of all forwarding agents and 
clearance procedures, management of the warehouses (in -house + 3PL) for 
goods receiving.  
    
• ERP Area: all kinds of support in using Dynamics Navision ERP system , 
correction of errors in the database, checking of outputs generated by ERP 
system. Implementation of the system when needed.  
• Reporting Area: data extraction (by ODBC or dataport) and processing for the 
management. Creation of reports using Business Analy tics (a Microsoft B.I. 
SW) 
• Realized Projects: VOIP phones for all Amik divisions, e -invoicing, data 
processing and organizing during start up of a new controlled company, 
computerization of warehouses and connection with the headquarter.  
 
2003 to 2006 CSA Srl 
Position: Senior Application Consultant  
Microsoft business solution partner. The core business of the company is the 
implementation of Microsoft Dynamics Navision ERP system  
• Development in organizing complete projects: custom requirements analysis, 
transferring of the analysis to the programmers, set up of the system with 
special reference to logistic and administrative areas, assistance after start up 
with minor programming changes in order to obtain the best final result.  
• Cooperation with  other Microsoft business partners for Navision new 
installations in abroad divisions of CSA’s customers. Close relationship with 
colleagues working in USA, UK and German Microsoft Business partners.
